sect1.title: Install Unix-like system and supporting software

sect2.title: a Unix-like system
sect2.para: You will need a computer running a unix-like system with the following software installed:

listitem.para: gmake and the compile and build environment.

note.title: BSD Note
note.para: BSD users: in most places in these instructions, gmake will work better than make. (more information on FreeBSD installation)

sect2.para: and optionally these programs, which are included in most distributions:

listitem.para: DocBook and supporting software (and install emacs keybindings for DocBook SGML)
a Mail Transport Agent, such as exim or sendmail (or install qmail from source)

sect2.para: To install a machine to the specifications of the Reference Platform, do the walkthrough of the Red Hat 8.0 Install for OpenACS.
